contest-event.event-date: Oct. 23, 1880 D Intercolonial Band Contest Intercolonial Band Contest 0 Other Intercolonial Band Contest intercolonial-band-contest Although an earlier contest in Sydney in 1880 had borne the same title, the Band Association of NSW ran its inaugural "Intercolonial Band Contest" in 1896. The second event, in 1897, was advertised as for the "Championship of Australasia", and is considered to be the first in the sequence of Australian national championships (noting that the federation of Australia did not occur until 1901). Exhibition Building, Prince Alfred Park, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia The contest was promoted by a Mr.J.E.Fulton. The advertisement for the contest appeared in the Daily Telegraph on the 27th September for the contest to be held over several days commencing on Saturday 2nd October ,then Monday concluding on the 23rd The competition entailed the performances of three Own Choice works over the three evenings The first two evenings were held on the lawns of the Exhibition Building ,but the final night was held at the Theatre Royal owing to bad weather Upon the decision of the adjudicators been made ,there was a disturbance in the upper section of the house and Mr. Thompson , bandmaster of the Headquarters Band declined to accept the second prize , and issued a challenge to the victors ( Naval Brigade) to play for either 50 or 100 pound a side June 14, 2016, 3:54 a.m. June 14, 2016, 7:07 a.m. 1 Naval Brigade (Sydney) John Devlin Nabucco 2 Volunteer Headquarters (Sydney) W.
